Rationale

Add ecological data to
http://geo.linkeddata.es
. By ecological data we mean (But we are not limited to!): distribution of taxa, pollution, distribution of ecosystems, and so on. By adding such data to the system we can nicely explore, for example, pollution/taxa distribution altogether, and things like that. Needless to say, we can do fancy SPARQL queries about ecosystems.

Things to try at some point in the future

If the ontology we use to model ecosystems and taxa is rich enough perhaps we can apply some inference (Obviously depending on performance issues) and generate new triples that were implicit in the original data sources. Something along the lines of the work described in "Analysis Of Cancer Omics Data In A Semantic Web Framework" (They use very simple inference against GO to generate new triples and then query for new possible cancer treatments -- nice and impressive).
I would also like to try using inference to check the collected information, with Pellet ICV:
http://clarkparsia.com/pellet/icv/
.
